newsitem.title: CANADA: UGG shareholders to vote on ADM deal.
newsitem.headline: UGG shareholders to vote on ADM deal.

text.p: Shareholders in Canada's second largest grain handling firm were scheduled to vote on Thursday after 0900 CDT/1400 GMT on whether to proceed with a C$113 million deal with Archer Daniels Midland Co.
United Grain Growers Ltd on May 29 announced a tentative deal in which ADM would acquire a 45 percent stake in the grain handler at C$16 a share.

Although Alberta Wheat Pool and Manitoba Pool Elevators, which own a total of 14.98 percent of UGG's outstanding limited common voting shares, declined to say how they would vote, many in Canada's grain industry expected them to vote against the deal.
AWP and MPE scuttled a C$13.75 a share hostile takeover bid for UGG in March after Manitoba Court of Queen's Bench ruled UGG's poison pill plan was valid.
UGG shareholders must also vote on whether to retain or revoke that poison pill after minority shareholder Oppenheimer & Co put the issue on the agenda.
Oppenheimer owns 13.16 percent of UGG and tried to force a shareholder vote on the poison pill for June 26, but Manitoba's Court of Queen's Bench dismissed its lawsuit.
